All DNA is selfish in that genes favored by natural selection will survive better that alternative versions of the gene. Most genes survive better when their host organism survives better. White fur is favored in polar bears because of their environment, so genes that contribute to whiteness will survive better than other versions of the gene. The point is that white bears may be selected for, but only evolve because they pass on white fur genes. So some biologists have concluded that it is most proper to describe genes as the basic unit of selection: these are what gets passed on.

"junk DNA" is a misnomer. It includes all the transcription factor binding sequences - the meta code that determines what genes are expressed and when, e.g. the behaviors of different cell types with the same organism. These factors are incredibly important in complicated organisms like humans. It's not "junk", you can't have a whole organism without them, unless that organism is a blob of cancer.

You confuse the issue by saying some genes are selfish and some are not.  A more clear way of expressing it is that all genes are 'selfish' in that they are more likely to still exist if they encourage their own replication, but that many genes are involved in systems where they support collectives that in turn increase the chance to reproduce for all the genes.  Still selfish, just in it with other genes for the combined advantage.

A Low Pressure System is going southeast, and low pressure systems are associated with rainy weather due to rising air forming clouds. Hurricanes spin counter-clockwise in the northern hemisphere because high-pressure systems spin clockwise around the low pressure area that becomes a hurricane. I have multiple reasons for my prediction, especially regarding the date.
